input_text:
Job Title: Legal AI Tutor (JD Required)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for qualified legal professionals to join one of the leading AI labs in Silicon Valley as Senior AI Tutors. This position pays $90/hour. In this role, you will leverage your expertise gained through your JD to test and enhance the capabilities of our cutting-edge AI models.
Responsibilities:Create challenging and domain-specific questions that go beyond the scope of a simple Google search and require a JD-level understanding to answer effectivelyProvide well-crafted answers to these questions, demonstrating the depth of knowledge expected from a legal expertEnsure that the questions and answers are not easily addressable by undergraduates in the legal field and are incomprehensible to experts from non-legal disciplinesCollaborate with the AI development team to refine and improve the model's performance based on your insights and feedback
Example of a question-and-answer pair:Question: In the context of the U.S. Supreme Court's decision in Citizens United v. FEC, how has the Court's interpretation of the First Amendment's protection of free speech impacted campaign finance regulations and the role of corporate money in political elections?
Answer Choices:A) The decision had minimal impact on campaign finance regulations, as corporations were already able to contribute to political campaigns through PACs.B) The Court's ruling overturned all campaign finance regulations, allowing unlimited corporate contributions to political campaigns.C) The decision upheld existing campaign finance regulations, maintaining restrictions on corporate political spending.D) The ruling expanded First Amendment protections for corporate political speech, striking down certain campaign finance restrictions and enabling increased corporate spending in elections.
Correct Answer: D) The ruling expanded First Amendment protections for corporate political speech, striking down certain campaign finance restrictions and enabling increased corporate spending in elections. The Court held that corporate funding of independent political broadcasts cannot be limited under the First Amendment, leading to the rise of super PACs and increased corporate influence in political campaigns.
Requirements:Juris Doctor (JD) from an accredited law schoolExtensive knowledge and practical experience in various legal disciplinesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent written communication abilitiesFamiliarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus
This is a part-time, remote position offering a competitive hourly rate of $90 per hour. You will be expected to work between 10-20 hours per week, with the flexibility to allocate your time according to your schedule. As a contractor, you will log your hours and receive payments via Deel, directly deposited into your bank account.
We are hiring multiple Senior AI Tutors to support our growing AI initiatives. If you are passionate about advancing AI in the legal field and want to contribute to the development of groundbreaking technologies, we encourage you to express your interest in this unique opportunity. We look forward to providing more details and discussing how your expertise can help shape the future of AI in the legal domain.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Legal AI Tutor
output_json.summary: Senior AI Tutor opportunity in Silicon Valley requiring JD.
job_responsibilities: Create challenging and domain-specific questions requiring JD-level understanding.
Provide well-crafted answers demonstrating depth of legal knowledge.
Ensure questions and answers are not easily addressable by undergraduates in legal field.
Collaborate with AI development team to refine and improve model's performance.
benefits: Competitive hourly rate of $90 per hour

other.content: Part-time, remote position with flexible hours between 10-20 hours per week. Payments via Deel, directly deposited into bank account.
Passion for advancing AI in the legal field and contributing to groundbreaking technology development.
